title: the Ministers and Secretaries (Amendment) Act 1939 (No. 36 of 1939), hereby
heading: 1. (1) This Order may be cited as the Heritage (Transfer of Departmental
text_raw:
1. (1) This Order may be cited as the Heritage (Transfer of Departmental 

Administration and Ministerial Functions) Order 2021. 

(2) This Order comes into operation on 24 June 2021.
text_norm: 1 (1) order may cited heritage (transfer departmental administration ministerial functions) order 2021 (2) order come operation 24 june 2021

title: the Ministers and Secretaries (Amendment) Act 1939 (No. 36 of 1939), hereby
heading: 2. (1) The administration and business in connection with the exercise,
text_raw:
2. (1) The administration and business in connection with the exercise, 
performance or execution of any functions transferred by this Order are 
transferred to the Department of Housing, Local Government and Heritage. 

(2) References to the Department of Tourism, Culture, Arts, Gaeltacht, Sport 
and Media contained in any Act or any instrument made under an Act and 
relating to any administration and business transferred by paragraph (1) shall, 
from the commencement of this Order, be construed as references to the 
Department of Housing, Local Government and Heritage.
text_norm: 2 (1) administration business connection exercise performance execution function transferred order transferred department housing local government heritage (2) reference department tourism culture art gaeltacht sport medium contained act instrument made act relating administration business transferred paragraph (1) shall commencement order construed reference department housing local government heritage

title: the Ministers and Secretaries (Amendment) Act 1939 (No. 36 of 1939), hereby
heading: 3. (1) The functions vested in the Minister for Tourism, Culture, Arts,
text_raw:
3. (1) The functions vested in the Minister for Tourism, Culture, Arts, 

Gaeltacht, Sport and Media – 

(a) by or under any of the provisions of the Acts specified in Part 1 

of the Schedule, 

(b) under the Regulations specified in Part 2 of the Schedule, and 

(c) 

to make a recommendation to which section 12(3)(b)(iii) of the 
Planning and Development Act 2000 (No. 30 of 2000) applies and 
to make observations to which section 12(3)(b)(iv) of that Act 
applies, 

are transferred to the Minister for Housing, Local Government and Heritage. 

(2) References to the Minister for Tourism, Culture, Arts, Gaeltacht, Sport 
and Media contained in any Act or instrument made under an Act and relating 
to any functions transferred by this Order shall, from the commencement of this 
Order, be construed as references to the Minister for Housing, Local Government 
and Heritage.

title: the Ministers and Secretaries (Amendment) Act 1939 (No. 36 of 1939), hereby
heading: 4. Where, immediately before the commencement of this Order, any legal
text_raw:
4. Where, immediately before the commencement of this Order, any legal 
proceedings are pending to which the Minister for Tourism, Culture, Arts, 
Gaeltacht, Sport and Media is a party and the proceedings have reference to any 
function transferred by this Order to the Minister for Housing, Local 
Government and Heritage, the name of the Minister for Housing, Local 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 25th June, 2021. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [302] 3 

Government and Heritage shall, in so far as the proceedings relate to any 
function transferred by this Order, be substituted in the proceedings for that of 
the Minister for Tourism, Culture, Arts, Gaeltacht, Sport and Media or added in 
the proceedings, as may be appropriate, and the proceedings shall not abate by 
reason of such substitution.

title: the Ministers and Secretaries (Amendment) Act 1939 (No. 36 of 1939), hereby
heading: 5. Anything commenced before the commencement of this Order by or
text_raw:
5. Anything commenced before the commencement of this Order by or 
under the authority of the Minister for Tourism, Culture, Arts, Gaeltacht, Sport 
and Media may, in so far as it relates to any function transferred by this Order to 
the Minister for Housing, Local Government and Heritage, be carried on or 
completed on or after such commencement by the Minister for Housing, Local 
Government and Heritage.
text_norm: 5 anything commenced commencement order authority minister tourism culture art gaeltacht sport medium may far relates function transferred order minister housing local government heritage carried completed commencement minister housing local government heritage

title: the Ministers and Secretaries (Amendment) Act 1939 (No. 36 of 1939), hereby
heading: 6. Every document (including any certificate or licence) granted or made in
text_raw:
6. Every document (including any certificate or licence) granted or made in 
the performance of a function transferred by this Order shall, if and in so far as 
it was operative immediately before the commencement of this Order, have 
effect from such commencement as if it had been granted or made by the 
Minister for Housing, Local Government and Heritage.
text_norm: 6 every document (including certificate licence) granted made performance function transferred order shall far operative immediately commencement order effect commencement granted made minister housing local government heritage

title: the Ministers and Secretaries (Amendment) Act 1939 (No. 36 of 1939), hereby
heading: 7. References to the Minister for Tourism, Culture, Arts, Gaeltacht, Sport
text_raw:
7. References to the Minister for Tourism, Culture, Arts, Gaeltacht, Sport 
and Media contained in the memorandum and articles of association of any 
company and relating to any function transferred by this Order shall, from the 
commencement of this Order, be construed as references to the Minister for 
Housing, Local Government and Heritage.
text_norm: 7 reference minister tourism culture art gaeltacht sport medium contained memorandum article association company relating function transferred order shall commencement order construed reference minister housing local government heritage

title: the Ministers and Secretaries (Amendment) Act 1939 (No. 36 of 1939), hereby
heading: 8. (1) All property, rights and liabilities held, enjoyed or incurred before the
text_raw:
8. (1) All property, rights and liabilities held, enjoyed or incurred before the 
commencement of this Order by the Minister for Tourism, Culture, Arts, 
Gaeltacht, Sport and Media, in connection with the functions transferred by this 
Order are transferred on the commencement to the Minister for Housing, Local 
Government and Heritage and, accordingly, without any further conveyance, 
transfer or assignment, on such commencement – 

(a) 

(b) 

(c) 

that property, both real and personal, vests in the Minister for 
Housing, Local Government and Heritage, 

those rights are rights of the Minister for Housing, Local 
Government and Heritage, and 

those liabilities are liabilities of the Minister for Housing, Local 
Government and Heritage. 

(2) All moneys, stocks, shares and securities transferred to the Minister for 
Housing, Local Government and Heritage by this Article which, on the 
commencement of this Order, are standing in the name of the Minister for 
Tourism, Culture, Arts, Gaeltacht, Sport and Media shall, on the request of the 
Minister for Housing, Local Government and Heritage, be transferred into the 
name of the Minister for Housing, Local Government and Heritage. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 4 [302]
